intro: Rubus australis, commonly known as the Australian blackberry, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Rubus australis is often found in open woodlands and coastal areas across southern Australia.
